Layer.onTouchUp

Function/Meaning
Finger released from screen
Type
Event of the Layer class
Syntax
onTouchUp(x, y, cx, cy, id)
Arguments
x The x-coordinate (in client coordinates) of the position where the finger was released.
y The y-coordinate (in client coordinates) of the position where the finger was released.
cx The horizontal contact area in pixels.
Always 1 if the device does not support this.
cy The vertical contact area in pixels.
Always 1 if the device does not support this.
id Touch ID.
During multi-touch, a unique value is assigned to each position, allowing identification of the touch point.
Description
Occurs when a finger is released from the touch panel.
This event occurs when the X and Y coordinates are within this layer.
However, unlike a mouse, it is determined by the current coordinates, so it may not be the same layer where onTouchDown occurred.
